turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I called your room from downstairs.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If I had answered, what were you gonna say?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Well, I'd say who I was and do you remember me and ask if you'd like to meet for a drink.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If I remembered you.  I came looking for you.  I would've said sure, let's do it.  But for all you knew I could show up with a SWAT team.  Why would you trust me?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It would be worth the risk.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You like taking risks.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: So do you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You really wear that suit.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That's not what you were about to say.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Remember how talkative you were?  In the trunk?  Adele said you do that when you're nervous.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: She did, huh.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You kept touching me, feeling my thigh.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, but in a nice way.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I might've smelled like a sewer, but you could tell I was a gentleman. They say John Dillinger was a pretty nice guy.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He killed a police officer.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I hear he didn't mean to.  The cop fell as Dillinger was aiming at his leg and got him through the heart.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What were you gonna do with me?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know.  I hadn't worked that part out yet.  All I knew was that I liked you, and I didn't want to leave you there, never see you again.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You waved to me in the elevator.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I wasn't sure you caught that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I couldn't believe it.  I was thinking of you by then, a lot, wondering what it would be like if we did meet.  Like if we could take a time-out...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Really?  I was thinking the same thing. If we could call time and get together for a while.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You know I saw you on the street.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Outside Adele's.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You were going to see her?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: To warn her about Chino.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So she did help you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't think we should get into that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, you're right.  Or Buddy.  I won't ask if he's with you or what you're doing here in Detroit.  Or if you've run into Glenn Michaels yet.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Don't talk like that, okay?  You scare me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You coming back?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm just going to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I want you to know something.  I wasn't looking for just a fuck, if that's what you're thinking.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why are you mad?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Or I did it for some kind of kinky thrill.  Score with a bank robber the way some women go for rough trade.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What about my motive? Now I can say I fucked a US Marshal. You think I will?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're not dumb.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know about that.  You can't do three falls and think you have much of a brain.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You getting serious on me now?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm trying not to.  I just wanna know what's gonna happen.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You know.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Come on, Jack -- don't.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Pretend I'm somebody else.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You think I'd shoot you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: If you don't, one of those guys will.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What're you now, a desperado?  Put the guns down.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I told you, I'm not going back.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Jack, but I can't shoot you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You just did, for Christ sake.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: He got three years and fined fifty million dollars and wrote 'em a fucking check.  Like that, fifty mil, signed his name.  Whoa-- little help here!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Who you talkin' to, Studs?  Me, or Buddy.  I can't tell, you got those shades on.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: You guys-- come on-- this is too heavy!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I guess the bright glare out here made it hard to see the numbers on the weights.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I'll take the shades off.  Just get this fuckin' thing off me.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Detroit.  Snoopy Miller told me uncut diamonds are as easy to move as cash.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Ever seen an uncut diamond, Studs? They look like plain old rocks.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: So.  What's your point?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: My point is, that's probably what you're gonna end up with.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: You think he's lying?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Use your head.  The guys got five million lying around his house, you really think he's gonna tell some motormouth he just met in prison about it?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Oh, hey, Studs?  We thought you were somebody else.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Studs.  Man, I haven't heard that since Lompoc.  What's going on?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Oh, nuthin'.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Take your sunglasses off.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I see better with them on.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You don't take 'em off, I'm gonna throw 'em off the overpass while they're still on your head.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Wait in the car.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: You're in civilization now, man, ease up.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'd like you to go wait in the car. How's that?  Take her with you and put her in back.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: In the trunk?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: The backseat.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Weren't you expecting us?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: That broad you picked up -- did you know she was a US Marshal, for Christ sake?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: She knew me from some bullshit dope bust. She drove me to court. Twice. You know what she said, we're in the car on the turnpike? "I never forget anybody I've cuffed and shackled."

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah?  She said that to you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What happened to your shades?  Someone finally step on 'em?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Whose blood you got all over you?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: These guys, man, they're crazy.  Shit.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I thought you guys were busted.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why?  Just because you left us standing on the side of the road?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Some people are going out of here. What if I told you where and when?

turns.speaker: PUP
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I expect you to look out for me, Pup, let me run off work details.

turns.speaker: PUP
turns.text: Okay.  How many going out?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I hear six.

turns.speaker: PUP
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Looks like tonight.

turns.speaker: PUP
turns.text: You know who they are?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I do, but I won't tell you just yet. Meet me in the chapel at eight-thirty, right before lock-down.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You don't wanna be standing there, the hacks start asking questions you don't wanna answer.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Oh, uh, right, thanks...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Sounds high, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Must be a real soft pillow.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're smart, Ripley, you'll tell this guy to fuck off.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Really?  Well, I uhhh...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: First of all, if he kills you, he's not gonna get any more money out of you.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Thanks for your help.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Tell me something.  What's it like, walk in a bank with a gun, stick it up?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know.  I never used a gun.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You'd be surprised what all you can get, you ask for it the right way.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You're the reason, Jack, I don't keep all my money in banks.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: No?  Where do you keep it, Dick?  I'm talking about all those uncut diamonds you told Glenn about.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're the one with balls, Dick, say something like that to someone like Glenn.  Or maybe you just forgot where you were for a minute.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yeah, but who's gonna believe Glenn? I mean, do <u>you</u> believe Glenn?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Plus, even it was true, he'd still have to figure out where I keep 'em.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Doesn't have to figure out shit.  You <u>told</u> him you keep 'em at your house.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: It's a big house.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Tell me something, Jack, how much longer you in here?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Twenty-two months, three days, two hours.  Why?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I was just thinking that I could use a guy like you, someone knows how to ask for things the right way.  I'm talkin' about when you're outta here.  I mean, you can't rob banks for ever.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It's a little late for me.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Hey, Jack?  Bullshit.  I didn't make my first million until I was forty- two.  Forty-two.  You really <u>want</u> to change, it's never too late.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm not exactly the nine-to-five type.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Who is? But then you gotta look at a job as more than just work. You gotta look at it as peace of mind. As security, you know what I mean? I got offices in Detroit, Miami, Boston, take your pick.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: My ex-wife's in Miami.  It's nice down there.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No need to decide now.  Be like the fish.  Let whatever happens happen.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: The fish?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yeah, fish live in the present.  They don't dwell on yesterday and they don't worry about tomorrow.  Even when a big fish attacks a little fish, there's no neurosis involved.  No guilt afterward. No whining on some fish-shrink's couch. They just do it.  They accept.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I can't say that I've paid that much attention to 'em before.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: The fish saved my life.  Two years ago, I found out I had high blood pressure.  So my doctor, he tells me to go get an aquarium, look at the fish every time I felt myself stressing out.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And the guy sent you a bill for this?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: It works.  You should try it sometime.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: The next time I walk into a bank.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I still haven't made up my mind yet.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What's to think about?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You goin' right back to work?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: First, I'm goin' to Israel for a year, study the Talmud, work on a Kibbutz... then come back, maybe take some tennis lessons.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Today, I'm offering you a lousy job at a lousy wage.  You think you're better than that?  Fine.  Show me.  Show me that you're really willing to change and we'll talk about something better. A lot better.  But first, Jack, you gotta earn it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How, Dick?  The way <u>you</u> earned it?  By marrying some rich broad owns the company, selling it off a piece at a time, then divorcing her?  What is this Knute Rockne, pull yourself up by the bootstraps bullshit?  Back in prison, guy like you, place like that, you were ice cream for freaks.  You were a goddamn dumpling.  Maurice and a dozen other guys coulda bled you till you had nothing.  Till you <u>were</u> nothing.  I saved your ass.  So you'll pardon me if I don't wanna sit on a fuckin stool all day saying "sign in here please" or "hey, pal, you can't park there."  Okay, Dick?  I can't do it.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Jack, I'm disappointed.  I guess I misjudged you.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Gentlemen.  I think we've calmed down now.  Haven't we, Jack?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Oh, yeah, I'm calm.  In fact, I'm totally "relaxed..."

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Foley?  That you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How are you, Richard?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, what the hell are you doing here?  What's going on?  Who's upstairs?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Maurice Miller, couple of his friends.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Maurice?  From Lompoc?  Good God.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Have they got Midge up there?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What kinda man lets a woman answer the door, this time a night?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: We thought it might be her husband. Sometimes he comes and checks up on her.  She told him I was down in Florida.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: A minute or two, you're gonna wish you were.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What do you want from me, Jack?  Name it.  You want money?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You gonna write me a check?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: We'll go to my bank.  I'll make a withdrawal.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Good God... they're shooting Midge!

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Siddown, Dick.  They're trying to open the safe, not your maid.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I can't believe you're still angry with me, Jack, after all this time.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm not angry, Richard.  In fact, I'm completely relaxed.  Thing is, I can't tell if it's the fish that're cooling me out or all those uncut diamonds on the bottom of the tank there.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Dumbfuck Glenn was right, there's about five million worth in there, wouldn't you say, Richard?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Five point two.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I were you, I'd get up and run.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I'm not leaving Midge.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Don't be an asshole, Richard.  They're gonna kill you.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: If that's my fate, so be it.  I'm not leaving.  I love her, Jack.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Hejira? What kinda name is that?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Islamic.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What's it mean, "No Hair"?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: The Hejira was the flight of Mohammed from Mecca in 622.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: The flight?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: The brothers in Leavenworth gave me the name.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You were at Leavenworth, huh?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: For a time.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Meaning time came, I left.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You busted out?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: I prefer to call it an exodus from an undesirable place.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And how long was it before they caught up with you?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: That time?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: There were others.

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Yeah.  That was the ninth.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: The <u>ninth</u>?

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Ten, you count the prison hospital in Ohio I walked away from.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You must be some kinda walker, Henry.

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Hejira.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And so now you're off to Glades.

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Apparently, yeah.  I was supposed to leave last night with the lady marshal, but for some reason she wanted to wait.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: She did, huh.

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Cheaper I guess, take us both down in one van.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, could be.  Or maybe she thought we'd have a lot to talk about.

turns.speaker: HEJIRA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know.  It's a long way down to Florida.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'll send it to you at Glades.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Jesus, what'd you crawl through, a sewer?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I got a big score lined up up north. They wouldn't even know about it, it wasn't for me.  I could do it right now myself, except it's so fucking cold up there in January--

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Glenn?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You don't remember me, do you?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: It couldn't have been out at Glades, if that's what you're thinking.  I was never out there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, that's not what I'm thinking.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: But you're sure we've met, huh?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Last fall, I drove you from the Palm Beach county jail to the federal courthouse, twice.  You're Glenn Michaels.  I never forget anyone I've cuffed and shackled.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Do we have a gun in the car?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I remember you now.  Shit.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Foley's not going to make it.  And if he goes down, Glenn, you go with him.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Look, I can understand if you and Foley are close.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: We're not.  I'm helping him, yeah--

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Wait. Have you helped him, Glenn? At this point, technically, I doubt you could be charged with aiding a fugitive. So you still have a choice. You can help him and risk going down again, get cuffed and shackled, hope to God you pull a reasonable judge, not some hard-on. Or, if you want to play it another way...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Take the next exit.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: What am I supposed to do <u>now</u>?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Glenn, take the exit.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: No way, man, no fuckin' way am I gonna turn myself in.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Glenn, are you trying to steal this car?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Jesus, I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Another one of those days, huh, nothing seems to go right?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I mean I'm not stealing the fucking car.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're not?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I already stole it.  Last week or whenever it was, in West Palm.  I can't be stealing it again, can I?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The two guys you were with -- that one, that isn't Maurice Miller, is it? I've seen Snoopy's mug shot and that didn't look like him.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Jesus.  How'd you know about Snoopy?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Glenn, I know your life history, who your friends are, where you've been and now, it looks like, where you're going.  Put your hands on the wheel.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: You're gonna bust me for picking up a car?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: For the car, for aiding and abetting a prison escape, and conspiring to do whatever you came here for.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Listen, these guys, they're gonna be out here any minute looking for me. They're fucking animals.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What's going on, Glenn?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Nothing.  I just wanna get the fuck outta here.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But I thought the whole thing was your idea?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Rippin' off Ripley was my idea, but these guys, man, they're into shit I can't handle.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ripley?  You mean the wall street guy?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Yeah, the plan was to pick him up at his office tomorrow, take him out to his house in Bloomfield Hills.  Now, I don't give a shit what they do.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: And is Foley a part of this?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: He's supposed to be, but he hasn't shown up yet, which is a good thing for him.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Maurice is gonna kill him, try and collect the reward.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But you say he hasn't shown up, you think he backed out?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I don't know-- he doesn't exactly confide in me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Gee, I wonder why not.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I'm freezing my ass off.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You want to get out of here, run, it'll warm you up.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But listen, Glenn.  If you're lying to me...

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I know, you'll find me.  Jesus, I believe it.  I keep thinking if you hadn't driven me to federal court last summer, you wouldn't even know who I am.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If I didn't know you, Glenn, by tomorrow you'd be in jail or dead.  Look at it that way.  Go on.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Snoopy.  Glenn Michaels.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Studs.  Hey, son, you must be one a them psychic friends.  I was just thinkin' about you.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Listen, Snoopy, I'm on my way up to Detroit and need a place to crash.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You crazy, come up <u>here</u>?  It's fuckin one degree outside.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I wanna talk to you about a job.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I can't really go into it right now. I'll just tell you it's someone big.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Some<u>one</u>?  Gimme a hint.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: It's a guy you know.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Gimme another hint.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: It's Richard Ripley.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: You there?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Oh, I'm here, all right.  I'm very here. Question is, why aren't <u>you</u> here?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Watch the road, boy.  I like this Town Car.  We can cruise the man's neighbourhood without getting the police or private security people on our ass.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Sure, right, they see Bigfoot driving around a black guy wearing shades and a lavender fucking bandanna, no, they won't think anything of it.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: It's lilac, man, the color, and the style's made known by Deion and other defensive backs in the pros.  I could be one of them living out here with doctors of my race and basketball players.  Okay, here comes Mr. Ripley's house up on the left.  Yeah.  The brick wall.  There's his drive, right there.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You sure Foley and his pal aren't coming up here, do this themself?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: If they're not busted now, they're gonna be.  It's wide open.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: So you still haven't said, how you wanna do it?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: I'll show you, soon as I get one more guy I'm gonna need, Moselle's brother, Kenneth.  Along with White Boy there.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Wait a minute. I'm letting you in on this, not all your friends.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You just ask me how we gonna do it. That's what I'm here for, tell you how.  We the experts.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Thing I'm worried about is you.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Yeah.  If you can step up and actually do it.  Understand?  'Stead of just talking the talk.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Can I do what?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Walk in a house with me, do this cross- dressin' nigga named Eddie Solomon I used to sell to been dealin' on his own.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: What-- when?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Right now, son.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I don't have to prove shit to you. The Ripley job is my job. You're either in or you're not. You wanna pop some crack dealer pissed you off, that's your problem, not mine.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Look, Glenn, I know you cool, but you don't have to give me no tone of voice, okay?  You don't like what I'm saying, you can get out anywhere along here you want.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: I think you're forgetting, this is my car.  I drove it up here.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Hey, shit, come on. I say I want this car, man, it's mine. You go get yourself another one. I say I'm in on Ripley? I'm in, with or without your ass. I say I want you to come along on another job, see if you for real or not, guess what you gonna do?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: That was some shit, huh?

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Why'd he have to do that to that girl?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Yeah, Kenneth, why you have to do that to that poor girl.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: It's all right with you, I'll just hang in the car.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: No.  You gonna stay close to me from now on.  So you don't disappear on me.

turns.speaker: GLENN
turns.text: Why would I do that?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Hi, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You look great.  Your dad taking good care of you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He took the week off so we'd have time together.  So far he's worked on his boat every day.  Dad?  Ray Nicolet.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Great.  We got one of 'em.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Foley?  Oh.  No, it was one of the Cubans.  Linares.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We went out there, full SWAT, two choppers, the whole bit, but Linares started shooting anyway.  We put him down, but somehow Chirino got away.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're a fighter?

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: How you know that?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I can tell.

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: I was...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What'd you fight, middleweight?

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: Light to super-middleweight, as my body developed.  You go about what, bantam?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Flyweight.

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: You know your divisions.  You like the fights?  Like the rough stuff?  Yeah, I bet you do.  Like to get down and tussle a little bit?  Like me and Tuffy, before she got run over, we use to get down on the floor and tussle.  I say to her, "You a good dog, Tuffy, here's a treat for you."  And I give Tuffy what every dog love best.  You know what that is? A bone.  I can give you a bone, too, girl.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're not my type.

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: Don't matter.  I let the monster out, you gonna do what it wants.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Just a minute.

turns.speaker: KENNETH
turns.text: What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You wanted to tussle, we tussled.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Moselle Miller?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm looking for Maurice.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: You find him, tell him the dog got run over and I'm out of grocery money.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's not Maurice?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: That's Kenneth, my brother.  He's talking on the phone.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: You like to sit down?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm looking for a friend of mine I think Maurice knows.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: You not with probation, one of those?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: You a lawyer?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, I'm not.  Maybe you know him. Glenn Michaels?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: Glenn?  No, I don't know any Glenn.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He said he stayed here last November.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: Here?  In this house?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He said he stayed with Maurice.

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: Well, he ain't even here that much. I like to know where he goes, but at the same time I don't want to know, you understand?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Your dog was killed?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: Got run over by a car.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What did you call it?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: Was a she, name Tuffy.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Where do you think I might find Maurice?

turns.speaker: MOSELLE
turns.text: I don't know -- the gym, the fights. I know he don't miss the fights. Having some tomorrow night at the State Theater. He use to take me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The State Theater?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You fit another Chanel suit in here?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Something better.  Open it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: It's a --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: --Sig-Sauer .38.  I love it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Thanks, Dad.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Happy birthday, kid.  You want another Coke?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Can't.  I gotta drive out to Glades, then I'm meeting Ray Nicolet at ten.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Which one is that?  The ATF guy?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He was.  Ray's with the F.B.I. now, he switched over.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: He's still married though, huh?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Technically.  They're separated.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Oh, he's moved out?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He's about to.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Then they're not separated, are they?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Can we change the subject?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: What're you doing at Glades?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Serving process, a Summons and Complaint.  Some con doing mandatory life doesn't like macaroni and cheese. He files suit, says he has no choice in what they serve and it violates his civil rights.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You know you can always step in, work with me full-time as one of my investigators.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You used to like it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Dad...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You'd meet doctors, lawyers -- nothing wrong with them necessarily if they're divorced.  Why settle for some cowboy cop who drinks too much and cheats on his wife?  That's the way those hotshots are, all of 'em.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I really gotta go.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: We don't get to talk much any more.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How 'bout I come next Sunday and watch the Super Bowl with you?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I'd like that.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You were talking in your sleep.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What'd I say?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: "Hey, yourself."

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: What are you thinking about?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The Sig Sauer you got me for my birthday.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Tell you what, you're a good girl, you might get another one for Christmas.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He doesn't even look like that.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, he looks a lot...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ray's with the F.B.I. Task Force, working on the prison break.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I see that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Was it Foley?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Off a tip?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Hello?  Yeah, she is.  Just a minute.  For you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Remember, pay attention to how she talks about Foley, her tone.  Do it right, she'll tell you things she wouldn't tell Burdon.  Tell her you think he's a nice guy.  No, first tell her about being in the trunk with him, in the dark for half an hour, and see how she takes it.  If she's in on it, what does she get for all the aggravation; cops breathing on her?  I bet nothing.  So she still likes him enough to stick her neck out.  You think that's possible?  What kind of guy is he?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He's pretty laid back, confident.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: He remind you of that guy, Tillman?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: But you know he's dirty and you still wanna see him again.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I want to bust his ass, put him in shackles.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Maybe.  But you're also curious about the man.  Twice last night you asked your married boyfriend Nicolet about him.  You were concerned, but you didn't want to show it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: My married boyfriend - setting him up with that news story so you could talk about infidelity.  I couldn't believe it.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You like the wild ones, don't you? Tillman, Nicolet and now Foley.  You know, I've always said there's a thin line between the cowboy cops and the armed robbers, all those guys that love to pack.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Foley kidnapped me.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Yeah, but you talked all the way from GCI to the turnpike.  It sounds more like a first date than a kidnapping.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: He waved to you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I couldn't swear to it, but I'm pretty sure he did.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You wave back?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I didn't have time.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I imagine you would've though.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Buddy's sister Regina Mary Bragg got two calls from Buddy up in Detroit this morning, called Burdon.  She's also the one gave Burdon Buddy's address.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So what I want to know is why Buddy still calls his sister every week even after she turned him in.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: He doesn't seem to hold a grudge. What I want to know is why, they got such a big score up north, did Foley hang around Miami for so long? Any thoughts on that one?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: None I'd like to share.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You gonna go get him?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It's possible.  Why?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I was just thinking... you could have a nice time with him on the plane -- like picking up where your interlude, or whatever you call it, left off. And then throw him in the can.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He knew what he was doing.  Nobody forced him to rob banks.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: My little girl, the tough babe.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Not yet.  Where's Mr. Ripley?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: I told you, he isn't here.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Out for the evening?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: He's in Florida.  Palm Beach.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: When's he due back?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You here all by yourself?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: That's right, just me.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Where's Ripley's safe at, he keep his valuables in.

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: I don't have any idea.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Let's go upstairs, have a look at the man's bedroom.  All right now, you and Mr. Buddy check the rooms down here. Look at the wall behind any pictures hanging on it.  Look at the walls in the closets.  The man has a safe, it's gonna be up there somewhere.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: How do I look, mama?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Like a fag.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: A'ight, this time we gotta get the motherfuckin' trajectory right...  Okay, on three:  One... Two...

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: The combination is three-ten-forty-four.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I've heard a lot about you, Mr. Sisco.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Likewise.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: In case no one knows what he does. Tell me, Ray, you ever wear one says, "Undercover"?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No.  Course not.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, someone spotted two of 'em in this hobo camp out by the airport, called the number--

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I knew it, soon as I saw they were offering a reward.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Did you pay the guy the reward?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, as soon as we got back.
